article:
:For the obsolete dinosaur fossil name, see [[Megalosaurus#"Scrotum humanum"]].

In some male mammals, the 'scrotum' is a dual-chambered protuberance of skin and
muscle, containing the testicles and divided by a septum. It is an
extension of the perineum, and is located between the penis and anus. In humans
and some other mammals, the scrotum becomes covered with pubic hairs at puberty.
The scrotum is homologous to the labia majora in females.
